<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of mutex_thread:
```c
static void *mutex_thread(void *arg)
{
	metal_mutex_t *l = arg;
	int i;

	for (i = 0; i < mutex_test_count; i++) {
		metal_mutex_acquire(l);
		usleep(1);
		metal_mutex_release(l);
	}

	return NULL;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
metal_mutex_acquire(l);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the call metal_mutex_acquire(l) invokes a separate mutex API function, not mutex_thread. There is no direct or indirect call from mutex_thread back to itself in the shown code. (It would only violate Rule 17.2 if metal_mutex_acquire — or any function it calls — invoked mutex_thread, creating indirect recursion.)
